result.execSummary:
The defendant William Edward Lemmon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs paid in full with cash bond previously posted.  The remaining portion of the cash bond has been applied to companion Waushara Co Case No 2016CF000040.
Time served sentence with Good Time and credit for 19 days of prior time served.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Edward Lemmon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for William Edward Lemmon
Current: 336 N Washington St, #86, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 08-11-2016)
Prior: W6884 State Road 21, Wautoma, WI 54982

16CF-40, 16CF-75 and 16CM-19 - All Cases Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant William Edward Lemmon in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Defendant William Edward Lemmon in custody.  Stephanie M. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sulewski also present as to companion 16CM-19.  Global resolution recited by ADA - Joint Recommendation for sentencing.  Def and both counsel concur with recital.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  16CF-40:  Ct 2 (POP w/PTAC) Plea:   NC  Cts 3 and 4 (Misd BJump):  NC  16CM-19 Ct 1 (OAR 2):   NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  16CF-40 Cts 1 and 5 DRI.  16CM-19 Cts 2 and 3 DRI.  16CF-75 DRI.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution - 16CF-40 - S/W all 3 Counts - 2 yrs probation.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru,  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Maintain FT gainful employment; Court Costs - 60 DTP - any outstanding bond to be applied to costs.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  16CM-19:  25 days direct SEH with 19 days TS credit - net effect of time served.  Court Costs plus DNA Sample/Surcharge as well - 60 DTP or PP.
Status conference on April 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Andrew John Sulewski in court, in person.  Steven Paul Anderson and Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Carver appearing via telephone as to 16CF-40 - dual representation cases.  Atty Carver requests an add'l STC - she expects cases will be resolved.  Offer rec'd from the State that needs more discussion with her client.  Atty Sulewski concurs with her request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on April 5, 2016 at 10:25 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant William Edward Lemmon in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sulewski requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 10:25 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD:  Defendant William Edward Lemmon in court, appearing late, with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Sulewski:  It appears counsel was not given correct contact information from SPD for Defendant.  Court will reinstate bond and vacate warrant previously authorized.  STC scheduled - In person with possible P/S.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Case Called @ 10:05 AM:   Attorney Andrew John Sulewski in court, appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Sulewski - concerned over lack of contact from Defendant and he does not appear today - whereabouts unknown.  The Court:  In light of nonappearance and lack of contact with his counsel - Bench Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.  $500 Cash Bond ordered forfeited.
No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:13 p.m. Defendant William Edward Lemmon in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting sig bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond. NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 09:45 am.
